intro: Oerstedianthus tuxtepecanus, commonly known as the Tuxtepec heather, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Mexico. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and rhododendrons, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained, acidic soils and thrives in partially shaded to sunny conditions. Its small, bell-shaped flowers range in color from white to pink and are often fragrant, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
